html:
Breakups & Shakeups

They've revised their statement with an interesting omission.

Colorado-based hardcore-meets-metalcore act Mouth For War has gone on "permanent hiatus." Mouth For War originally issued a statement on their Instagram signed by guitarists Gabe Moya and Jonah Starbuck, drummer Mason Sego, and bassist Michael Guglielmi saying: "Due to recent events Mouth For War will be going on a permanent hiatus. Thank you for everything. Be on the lookout for what the 4 of us do next."

The statement has now been revised to read: "Due to recent events Mouth For War will be going on a permanent hiatus. Thank you for everything. Please respect the privacy of ALL members." Notably absent from the original statement was vocalist Trae Roberts.

Mouth For War's final effort was their 2024 standalone single "The Earth's Cold Embrace", which you can stream below.
